title: Vaccine makers’ shares jump after bird flu death in US - Financial Times
summary:
Vaccine Makers' Shares Surge Following First Human Bird Flu Death in the US

Publication Date: Tuesday
Source: Financial Times

The stock prices of vaccine manufacturers rose sharply on Tuesday after the US reported its first human death from the H5 strain of bird flu, highlighting concerns over the outbreak.

  • Moderna's stock rose by 11.6%, while Novavax gained 10.8% and CureVac's shares increased by 5%.
  • The elderly patient from Louisiana had underlying health conditions and was confirmed dead by the CDC.
  • Since the start of 2024, there have been 66 reported cases of H5N1 bird flu in the US, with the CDC stating that the risk to the general public remains low.
  • Most infections are attributed to animal-to-human exposure, with no evidence of person-to-person transmission identified.
  • Health officials are closely monitoring the outbreak, which has severely affected poultry farms and cattle operations, especially in California.
  • The US government has a stockpile of bird flu vaccines ready for deployment.
“Most importantly, no person-to-person transmission spread has been identified.”

The rising stocks reflect the ongoing concerns about avian flu in the US and the proactive steps being taken by vaccine manufacturers.
newTitle: Vaccine Makers' Shares Surge Following First Human Bird Flu Death in the US

title: Donald Trump Escalates Threats Against Canada, Greenland and Panama; Refuses to rule out use of military - Hindustan Times
summary:
Trump Threatens Military Action Over Greenland, Canada, and Panama in New Press Conference

Date: Jan 08, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent press conference, President-elect Donald Trump expressed intentions to increase US influence in Greenland, Canada, and the Panama Canal, leaving open the possibility of military or economic coercion.

  • Trump refused to eliminate the option of military confrontation over US control of Greenland and Panama.
  • He stated, “We need them for economic security,” emphasizing the strategic importance of these territories.
  • Trump proposed using high-level tariffs to pressure Denmark regarding Greenland.
  • He suggested that Canada could become the 51st state due to trade deficits and US military support.
  • He characterized the Gulf of Mexico as potentially renamed to the “Gulf of America” to assert dominance in the region.
“I can’t assure you on either of those two, but I can say this, we need them for economic security.”

Trump's remarks indicate a willingness to leverage US power against allies, potentially undermining long-term relationships in North America.
newTitle: Trump Threatens Military Action Over Greenland, Canada, and Panama in New Press Conference

V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath - NDTV
summary:
V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath

Date: New Delhi

The Centre has appointed V Narayanan as the new chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation and Secretary, Department of Space. Mr Narayanan will take over from S Somanath, the current head of the organisation, on January 14.

  • V Narayanan is currently the head of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • He played a key role in the development of India's cryogenic engine technology.
  • Mr Narayanan aims to take ISRO to greater heights with a clear roadmap for the future.
  • He has been with ISRO since 1984 and has held various significant positions.
  • S Somanath, the outgoing chief, led ISRO during significant missions including the successful Moon landing.
“We have a clear roadmap for India and I hope to take ISRO to greater heights as we have great talent,” - V Narayanan

In conclusion, V Narayanan's appointment marks a new chapter in ISRO's leadership, promising continued advancements in India's space exploration efforts.
newTitle: V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath

Source: The Verge

Technics has unveiled its latest wireless earbuds, the EAH-AZ100, featuring proprietary fluid magnetic drivers that enhance sound quality and reduce distortion. Priced at $299.99, these earbuds come equipped with advanced noise cancellation technology and support for Dolby Atmos.

  • Earbuds utilize proprietary fluid magnetic drivers for improved sound quality.
  • Support Dolby Atmos with spatial audio head tracking.
  • Active noise cancellation personalized by ear shape detection.
  • Bluetooth multipoint connectivity for up to three devices.
  • 10-hour battery life with an additional 28 hours from the charging case.
  • IPX4 water resistance rating.
“They certainly have the on-paper credentials... the incumbent rivals occupying this tier of wireless earbuds should be listening.”

The Technics EAH-AZ100 earbuds represent a significant advancement in earbud technology, promising to redefine expectations in the flagship wireless earbuds market.

title: India’s cricket stars skip domestic grind: Virat Kohli last played domestic red-ball cricket in 2012, Rohit Sharma in 2016 - The Indian Express
summary:
India’s cricket stars skip domestic grind: Virat Kohli last played domestic red-ball cricket in 2012, Rohit Sharma in 2016

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The article discusses how top Indian cricketers, including Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, have not participated in domestic red-ball cricket for several years, impacting the team's performance in international tests.

  • Virat Kohli last played in a Ranji Trophy game in 2012, and Rohit Sharma in 2016.
  • In the past four years, key players have participated in only four long-format domestic matches collectively.
  • The Indian team recently lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to Australia, marking a major setback.
  • Former players and officials emphasize the necessity of engaging in domestic cricket to maintain competitive readiness.
  • There is concern about the decline in the quality of Indian players emerging from the domestic circuit.
“Without game time in the middle, their game will stagnate…” - A team management member

Experts are calling for changes in the culture of commitment towards domestic cricket, warning that neglecting it could lead to further decline in performance.
newTitle: India's Cricket Stars Abandon Domestic Matches: A Look at the Consequences

title: NASA astronaut Donald Pettit captures video of stunning auroras from International Space Station| Video - Hindustan Times
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy - The Indian Express
summary:
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the First Advance Estimates (FAEs) of India’s GDP growth for the financial year 2024-25. These estimates suggest that India's nominal GDP is projected to reach Rs 324 lakh crores, growing 9.7% over the previous financial year.

  • The estimated nominal GDP for FY25 is $3.8 trillion at the exchange rate of 85 rupees to a dollar.
  • Real GDP is expected to be Rs 184.9 lakh crores, accounting for 57% of nominal GDP, indicating a growth deceleration.
  • Private consumption demand (PFCE) plays a crucial role, contributing almost 60% to GDP.
  • Government spending growth has been slow, averaging just 4.2% for the current year.
  • Investments have stalled since 2014, leading to reduced productive capacity growth.
"When one considers a slightly longer period, it becomes clear that India’s real economy is growing at less than 5% per annum."

The latest GDP figures serve as a reality check, revealing that while India's growth appears strong, much of this is boosted by a low base effect from the pandemic's economic contraction.
newTitle: India's Economic Outlook: Insights from the Latest GDP Estimates

title: Bird flu: First death from H5N1 strain reported in US - BBC.com
summary:
Bird flu: First death from H5N1 strain reported in US

Publication Date: Recent Release Source: Louisiana Department of Health

The first bird-flu related death in the US has been confirmed by the Louisiana department of health, involving a patient over the age of 65 with underlying health conditions who contracted the H5N1 strain.

  • The patient was hospitalized after contracting the virus.
  • No person-to-person transmission or other cases have been identified.
  • The individual was exposed to both a personal flock and wild birds.
  • Current public health risk for the general population is low, but those in close contact with birds are at higher risk.
  • Since 2024, there have been 66 confirmed cases of H5N1 in the US.
While the current public health risk for the general public remains low, people who work with birds, poultry or cows, or have recreational exposure to them, are at higher risk.

This incident highlights the ongoing risk of bird flu and the importance of monitoring the virus, as nearly half of reported human cases have resulted in death.
newTitle: First Death from H5N1 Bird Flu Reported in the US

title: Lenovo’s dual-screen Yoga Book 9i gets bigger displays - The Verge
Students’ body, teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments - The Hindu
summary:
Students’ body, teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Left-leaning Students’ Federation of India (SFI) has rejected the newly released Draft University Grants Commission (UGC) regulations, describing it as an attempt to centralize and corporatize educational institutions.

  • The SFI argues that the draft gives Governors a greater role in appointing Vice-Chancellors, making the selection process opaque.
  • It allows for industry experts to be considered for Vice-Chancellor roles, which the SFI claims dilutes academic quality.
  • Concerns were raised about the shift from research focus to reinforcing existing knowledge, potentially increasing workload for teachers.
“It is quite evident that the process of short-listing candidates for interview and final selection is very opaque: there’s no clarity about whoever will be called.” - SFI Leaders Mayukh Biswas and V.P. Sanu

This draft regulation has sparked a debate on the direction of higher education in India, with various stakeholders voicing their concerns over the implications for academic integrity and quality of education.
newTitle: Students’ body, teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments

title: Eyewitness video captures destruction after powerful earthquake rocks Tibet - Hindustan Times
summary:
Eyewitness Video Captures Destruction After Powerful Earthquake Rocks Tibet

Date: Jan 07, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A powerful earthquake measuring 6.8 struck near Tibet's holiest cities, killing 126 people and destroying several homes. Eyewitness videos shared by Reuters depict the destruction and chaos following the quake.

  • The earthquake's epicentre was 80 km (50 miles) north of Mount Everest.
  • Tremors were felt in Nepal, Bhutan, and India.
  • Rescue teams are currently searching through rubble for trapped individuals.
  • The Dalai Lama expressed his sadness over the event and offered prayers for the victims.
  • Many buildings, particularly older homes, suffered significant damage.
"I offer my prayers for those who have lost their lives and extend my wishes for a swift recovery to all who have been injured." - Dalai Lama

The earthquake has raised concerns over future safety and preparedness in the region.
newTitle: Eyewitness Video Shows Aftermath of Tibet Earthquake
